creator: javayou@gmail.com
text:
The busy count of a server is abnormal

Here is the screen scrap

http://www.dlog.cn/html/diary/showlog.vm?sid=2&log_id=1606

creator: rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
Which version of mod_jk?

Would i be possible for you to try subversion head?

I see this in my status monitor too.
Busy is very similar to the max value of unsigned long int :)

Using mod_jk 1.2.15 on Apache 2.2. 2 tomcat ajp13 workers connected - same hw setup but only one 
shows this behaviour (last in chain). Uname -a: 
Linux app2 2.6.9-34.0.1.ELsmp #1 SMP Wed May 17 16:59:36 EDT 2006 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/
Linux 

I will try svn head and check if the problem persists.
Any additional info needed for debugging?
creator: bugs@bergstroem.nu

text:
Oh, maybe should mention that the apache front (that actually runs mod_jk, sorry for my eariler comment)  
is:
FreeBSD front 6.1-STABLE FreeBSD 6.1-STABLE #0: Wed May 31 18:52:11 CEST 2006     johan@front:/usr/
obj/usr/src/sys/SMP  amd64
creator: bugs@bergstroem.nu
rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
Please try with subversion head. We changed several things around the counters
and the synchronization.

If the problem is not reproduceable with head any more - fine, we are going to
have a 1.2.16 soon.

If the problem is still there, could you also try with pessimistic locking
(worker.yourloadbalancer.lock=P) to check, if that makes a difference.

By the way, you can add now "?refresh=10" to the URL of your status worker to
make the status view update every 10 seconds :)

I've had latest svn running for some 5-6 hours now - no trace of the bug in question.
Haven't tried pessimistic locking (since it worked 'out of the box') - should i do this?

?refresh was neat :) 

While im at it - shouldn't one escape ampersands (&) in anchor hrefs?
creator: bugs@bergstroem.nu
rainer.jung@kippdata.de
text:
Thanks for testing subversion head! Good to know, the problem seems to be fixed
(as expected). No need for pessimistic locking, if optimistic is working for you.

Closing the original bug report.

Could you send a short mail to the dev list, what you want to be escaped?

creator: bugs@bergstroem.nu
text: Rainer: Will do. Cheers for your fast responses and for nailing the bug!
